description.narrative: One million school children in 23 districts have increased access to safe water and appropriate sanitation facilities through hygiene education by 2016, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, women, children and youth in 20 selected districts, demand and benefit from increased and more equitable utilization of quality health, nutrition, population, education, water, sanitation and HIV services

participating-org.narrative: DPHE GROUNDWATER CIRCLE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH ENGINEE
WATER AND SANITATION FOR THE URBAN

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: One million school children in 23 districts have increased access to safe water and appropriate sanitation facilities through hygiene education by 2016

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, UNICEF's technical and financial assistance contributed to the use of improved drinking water sources and sex-segregated improved sanitation facilities by a cumulative total of 81 per cent of the schools in 20 UNDAF and 3 arsenic-prone districts. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Number (and proportion) of schools with budgetary allocations for Operation and Maintenance of WASH facilities

actual.value: 2016:580 schools (about 72% of the schools in programme areas) have increased budgetary allocations for Operation and Maintenance of WASH facilities

title.narrative: Proportion/number of school children in programme area with functional handwashing facilities (with soap and water)

actual.value: 2016:47.2% of schools in programme area using functional handwashing facilities (with soap and water)

title.narrative: Proportion/number of school children in programme area using gender-segregated improved sanitation facilities

actual.value: 2016:75.9% of schools in programme area using gender-segregated improved sanitation facilities

title.narrative: Proportion/number of school children in programme area using an improved drinking water source

actual.value: 2016:81 % of 800 schools in programme area using an improved drinking water source
